intro: Psychotria ovoidea, commonly known as the egg-shaped psychotria, is a tropical shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded forest environments. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, waxy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small, green berries that turn red when mature. Psychotria ovoidea is also notable for its association with certain species of epiphytic plants and its role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitats.
